attributes.action: urgently address the difficulties many children with special needs face in accessing an adequate and appropriate education in mainstream schools, by:
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Making special needs awareness a compulsory part of teacher training, including awareness of education and disability laws and the appropriate and safe use of restraint 
Ensuring all Teaching Assistants who are supporting a child with special needs have relevant training related to the child's needs 
Giving the responsibility to assess the special needs of children to an independent panel in order to remove the conflict of interest that currently exists within Local Education Authorities where they are responsible for both assessing need, as well as funding, provision and monitoring 
Providing transparency in the process of statutory assessment, including audits of the time it takes from a parent or school's first application to the actual delivery of a Statement of SEN, and reduce the maximum time allowed to provide a Statement once it is agreed that one is needed 
Addressing the problem of the bullying of special needs children in mainstream schools as a priority. 60% of children with asperger's and 40% with autism are bullied in school,in nearly half these cases (44%) the school takes no action and in more than 1/2 the child has missed school or had to change schools
